intro: Auriculardisia sordida, commonly known as the sordid ear-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive ear-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
